titleStmt.title: The last speech of Col. Eusebius Andrews, sometimes a lawyer of Lincolns-Inne, at the time of his execution on the scaffold at Tower-hill, Thursday the 22 of August, 1650 with several questions propounded to him by Doctor Swadling, and his answer thereunto.
titleStmt.author: Andrews, Eusebius, d. 1650.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
